1: %% This suite tests the incremental mode which for now woirks as follows:
    2: %% You can specify which files you want in your plt, incremental mode will
    3: %% do the analysis needed to get the PLT into a good state and report the
    4: %% warnings from the modules which it re-analyzed.
    5: 
    6: -module(incremental_SUITE).
    7: 
    8: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    9: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   10: -include("dialyzer_test_constants.hrl").
   11: 
   12: -export([suite/0,
   13:          all/0,
   14:          report_new_plt_test/1,
   15:          report_degree_of_incrementality_test/1,
   16:          report_no_stored_warnings_test/1,
   17:          report_stored_warnings_no_files_changed_test/1,
   18:          report_stored_warnings_only_files_safely_removed_test/1,
   19:          report_old_plt_version_number_test/1,
   20:          report_old_plt_version_hash_test/1,
   21:          report_legal_warnings_added/1,
   22:          report_legal_warnings_removed/1,
   23:          incremental_test/1,
   24:          incremental_select_warnings_test/1,
   25:          add_and_remove_test/1,
   26:          add_and_remove_test_with_unknown_warnings/1,
   27:          verify_plt_info/1,
   28:          verify_plt_info_with_unknown_warnings/1,
   29:          fixing_all_warnings/1,
   30:          default_apps_config_xdg/1,
   31:          default_apps_config_env_var/1,
   32:          default_apps_config_env_var_prioritised_over_xdg/1,
   33:          legal_warnings_config_xdg/1,
   34:          paths_config_xdg/1,
   35:          multiple_plts_unsupported_in_incremental_mode/1]).
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:   [{timetrap, ?plt_timeout}].
   39: 
   40: all() -> [report_new_plt_test,
   41:           report_degree_of_incrementality_test,
   42:           report_no_stored_warnings_test,
   43:           report_stored_warnings_no_files_changed_test,
   44:           report_stored_warnings_only_files_safely_removed_test,
   45:           report_old_plt_version_number_test,
   46:           report_old_plt_version_hash_test,
   47:           report_legal_warnings_added,
   48:           report_legal_warnings_removed,
   49:           incremental_test,
   50:           incremental_select_warnings_test,
   51:           add_and_remove_test,
   52:           add_and_remove_test_with_unknown_warnings,
   53:           verify_plt_info,
   54:           verify_plt_info_with_unknown_warnings,
   55:           fixing_all_warnings,
   56:           default_apps_config_xdg,
   57:           default_apps_config_env_var,
   58:           default_apps_config_env_var_prioritised_over_xdg,
   59:           legal_warnings_config_xdg,
   60:           paths_config_xdg,
   61:           multiple_plts_unsupported_in_incremental_mode].
   62: 
   63: erlang_module() ->
   64:    case code:where_is_file("erlang.beam") of
   65:        non_existing ->
   66:            filename:join([code:root_dir(),
   67:                          "erts", "ebin", "erlang.beam"]);
   68:       EBeam ->
   69:           EBeam
   70:    end.
   71: 
   72: verify_plt_info_with_unknown_warnings(Config) ->
   73:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
   74:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
   75:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" ||
   76:                                  Module <- Modules] end,
   77:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "verify_plt_info.iplt"),
   78:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
   79:     ErlangModule = erlang_module(),
   80:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {warnings, [unknown]}],
   81:     AllSubSets = all_subsets(all_mods()),
   82:     Run = fun(Mods) -> run_dialyzer(incremental, [ErlangModule | ToPath(Mods)], Opts) end,
   83:     [run_and_verify_plt_info_with_unknown_warnings(Subset, Run, Plt) ||
   84:         Subset <- AllSubSets].
   85: 
   86: run_and_verify_plt_info_with_unknown_warnings(Subset, Run, PltFile) ->
   87:     _ = Run(Subset),
   88:     {Plt, {iplt_info, _Md5, _ModDeps, Warnings, _LegalWarnings}} =
   89:         dialyzer_iplt:plt_and_info_from_file(PltFile),
   90:     dialyzer_plt:delete(Plt),
   91:     verify_unknown_warnings(Subset, Warnings).
   92: 
   93: verify_unknown_warnings(Subset, Warnings) ->
   94:     Unused = all_mods() -- Subset,
   95:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) -> check_unknown_warnings(Mod, Unused, Warnings) end, Subset),
   96:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) -> check_unused_mod_warnings(Mod, Warnings) end, Unused).
   97: 
   98: check_unknown_warnings(Mod, Unused, Warnings) ->
   99:     Unknown = [unknown_function_warning(M) ||
  100:                   M <- Unused, lists:member(Mod, depends_on(M))],
  101:     Other = [warning_for_module(Mod)],
  102:     Expected = lists:sort(Unknown ++ Other),
  103:     Stored = lists:sort(replace_location(maps:get(Mod, Warnings))),
  104:     Expected = Stored.
  105: 
  106: unknown_function_warning(M) ->
  107:     {warn_unknown, loc, {unknown_function, {M, id, 1}}}.
  108: 
  109: verify_plt_info(Config) ->
  110:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  111:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  112:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" ||
  113:                                  Module <- Modules] end,
  114:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "verify_plt_info.iplt"),
  115:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  116:     ErlangModule = erlang_module(),
  117:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}],
  118:     AllSubSets = all_subsets(all_mods()),
  119:     Run = fun(Mods) -> run_dialyzer(incremental, [ErlangModule | ToPath(Mods)], Opts) end,
  120:     [run_and_verify_plt_info(Subset, Run, Plt) || Subset <- AllSubSets].
  121: 
  122: run_and_verify_plt_info(Subset, Run, PltFile) ->
  123:     _ = Run(Subset),
  124:     {Plt, {iplt_info, Md5, ModDeps, Warnings, _LegalWarnings}} =
  125:         dialyzer_iplt:plt_and_info_from_file(PltFile),
  126:     dialyzer_plt:delete(Plt),
  127:     verify_md5_list([erlang|Subset], Md5),
  128:     verify_mod_deps(Subset, ModDeps),
  129:     verify_warnings(Subset, Warnings).
  130: 
  131: verify_md5_list(AllModules, Md5) ->
  132:     ExpectedModules = lists:sort(AllModules),
  133:     ActualModules = lists:sort([ModuleName || {ModuleName, _CheckSum} <- Md5]),
  134:     case ExpectedModules =:= ActualModules of
  135:         true ->
  136:             ok;
  137:         false ->
  138:             ct:pal("Expected modules: ~p~nActual Modules:~p~n",
  139:                    [ExpectedModules, ActualModules]),
  140:             ExpectedModules = ActualModules
  141:     end.
  142: 
  143: verify_mod_deps(Subset, ModDeps) ->
  144:     Unused = all_mods() -- Subset,
  145:     DependsOn = fun(Mod) -> depends_on(Mod) -- Unused end,
  146:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) -> check_one_mod(Mod, ModDeps, DependsOn) end, Subset).
  147: 
  148: check_one_mod(Mod, ModDeps, DependsOn) ->
  149:     StoredDeps = lists:sort(rewrite_ans(dict:find(Mod, ModDeps))),
  150:     ExpectedDeps = lists:sort(DependsOn(Mod)),
  151:     case ExpectedDeps =:= StoredDeps of
  152:         true ->
  153:             ok;
  154:         false ->
  155:             ct:pal("Expected deps: ~p~nStored deps:~p~n",
  156:                         [ExpectedDeps, StoredDeps]),
  157:             ExpectedDeps = StoredDeps
  158:     end.
  159: 
  160: rewrite_ans({ok, Value}) -> Value;
  161: rewrite_ans(error) -> [].
  162: 
  163: verify_warnings(Subset, Warnings) ->
  164:     Unused = all_mods() -- Subset,
  165:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) -> check_warnings(Mod, Warnings) end, Subset),
  166:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) -> check_unused_mod_warnings(Mod, Warnings) end, Unused).
  167: 
  168: check_warnings(Mod, Warnings) ->
  169:     StoredWarnings = lists:sort(replace_location(maps:get(Mod, Warnings))),
  170:     ExpectedWarnings = [warning_for_module(Mod)],
  171:     ExpectedWarnings = StoredWarnings.
  172: 
  173: check_unused_mod_warnings(Mod, Warnings) ->
  174:     false = maps:is_key(Mod, Warnings).
  175: 
  176: add_and_remove_test_with_unknown_warnings(Config) ->
  177:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  178:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  179:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" ||
  180:                                  Module <- Modules] end,
  181:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "add_and_remove.iplt"),
  182:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  183:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {warnings, [unknown]}, {report_mode, verbose}],
  184:     Run = fun(Mods) ->
  185:             run_dialyzer_for_modules_analyzed(incremental,
  186:                          [erlang_module() | ToPath(Mods)],
  187:                          [{warning_files, ToPath(Mods)} | Opts])
  188:           end,
  189:     %% We ignore empty Mods, since no warning modules modules is
  190:     %% interpreted as a request to show all warning modules (for
  191:     %% convenience). However, if all module warnings are shown and
  192:     %% 'unknown' warnings are enabled, we get a load of 'unknown'
  193:     %% warnings from the built-in Erlang module, so we exclude that
  194:     %% case here
  195:     AllSubSets = [Mods || Mods <- all_subsets(all_mods()), Mods =/= []],
  196:     %Pairs = [{I, N} || I <- AllSubSets, N <- AllSubSets], % All pairs takes ~ 10 mins to run
  197:     Pairs = some_pairs(AllSubSets),
  198:     [run_one_add_and_remove_test(Initial, New, Run, true) || {Initial, New} <- Pairs],
  199:     ok.
  200: 
  201: %% Run the tests to add and remove modules for some combinations
  202: add_and_remove_test(Config) ->
  203:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  204:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  205:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  206:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "add_and_remove.iplt"),
  207:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  208:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {warnings, [no_unknown]}],
  209:     Run = fun(Mods) -> run_dialyzer_for_modules_analyzed(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(Mods)], Opts) end,
  210:     AllSubSets = [Mods || Mods <- all_subsets(all_mods())],
  211:     %Pairs = [{I, N} || I <- AllSubSets, N <- AllSubSets], % All pairs takes ~ 10 mins to run
  212:     Pairs = some_pairs(AllSubSets),
  213:     [run_one_add_and_remove_test(Initial, New, Run, false) || {Initial, New} <- Pairs],
  214:     ok.
  215: 
  216: 
  217: %% Runs a test where we first run the analysis on the InitialSet, and
  218: %% then run the analysis on the newset, checking that we get the
  219: %% warnings we expect given this change of modules. Supports running
  220: %% with unknown function and types and also with getting warnings for
  221: %% all modules, not just the re-analyzed ones.
  222: run_one_add_and_remove_test(InitialSet, NewSet, Run, WithUnknown) ->
  223:     {ExpectedErrors, ExpectedAnalyzed} =
  224:         expected_warnings_and_analyzed_add_and_remove(InitialSet, NewSet, WithUnknown),
  225:     _ = Run(InitialSet),
  226:     {ErrorsRaw, Analyzed} = Run(NewSet),
  227:     Errors = ordsets:from_list(replace_location(ErrorsRaw)),
  228: 
  229:     if Errors =/= ExpectedErrors ->
  230:             ct:pal("Initial modules: ~p~nNew Modules:~p~nModules analyzed:~p~nModules expected to be analyzed:~p~n"
  231:                    "Returned Warnings:~p~nExpected Warnings:~p~n",
  232:                    [InitialSet, NewSet, Analyzed, ExpectedAnalyzed, Errors, ExpectedErrors]),
  233:             {Errors, Analyzed} = {ExpectedErrors, ExpectedAnalyzed};
  234:         true ->
  235:             ok
  236:     end.
  237: 
  238: %% Just create some pairs.
  239: some_pairs([A, B | Rest]) ->
  240:     [{A, B} | some_pairs([B|Rest])];
  241: some_pairs(_) -> [].
  242: 
  243: 
  244: %% We expect incrementality to minimise the number of modules
  245: %% re-analysed, but still report warnings for modules which didn't
  246: %% need to be re-analysed because their warnings were cached.  We
  247: %% expect a module to be re-analyzed when it is freshly added or when
  248: %% one of its transistive dependencies have been added or removed,
  249: %% using the dependency graph from the previous run.  Adds unknown
  250: %% function warnings when they are supported, and generates all
  251: %% warnings when that feature is turned on.
  252: expected_warnings_and_analyzed_add_and_remove(Initial, New, WithUnknown) ->
  253:     InitialSet = ordsets:from_list(Initial),
  254:     NewSet = ordsets:from_list(New),
  255:     Removed = ordsets:from_list(InitialSet -- NewSet),
  256:     Added = ordsets:from_list(NewSet -- InitialSet),
  257:     Changed = ordsets:union(Removed, Added),
  258:     All = ordsets:from_list(all_mods()),
  259:     Missing = ordsets:subtract(All, NewSet),
  260:     DependsOn = fun(Mod) -> depends_on(Mod, fun(X) -> lists:member(X, InitialSet) end) end,
  261:     Dependencies = ordsets:from_list([Mod || C <- Changed, Mod <- depends_on_transitively(C, DependsOn)]),
  262:     Analyzed = ordsets:intersection(ordsets:union(Added, Dependencies), NewSet),
  263:     WarnModules = NewSet,
  264:     UnknownWarnings =
  265:         [unknown_function_warning(M) ||
  266:             WithUnknown,
  267:             Mod <- WarnModules,
  268:             M <- Missing,
  269:             lists:member(Mod, depends_on(M))],
  270:     {ordsets:from_list([warning_for_module(Mod) ||
  271:                            Mod <- WarnModules] ++ UnknownWarnings), Analyzed}.
  272: 
  273: %% Run the incremental test for all combination of the 6 modules,
  274: %% checking that we get the expected level of incrementality, i.e. we
  275: %% only reanalyze what we need to given what has changed
  276: incremental_test(Config) ->
  277:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  278:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  279:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" ||
  280:                                  Module <- Modules] end,
  281:     Change = fun(M) -> change_module(DataDir, PrivDir, M) end,
  282:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "incremental.iplt"),
  283:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  284:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {warnings, [no_unknown]}],
  285:     AllWarnings = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  286:     Run = fun() ->
  287:                   run_dialyzer_for_modules_analyzed(incremental,
  288:                                                     [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())],
  289:                                                     Opts)
  290:           end,
  291:     [run_one_incremental_test(SubSet, Change, Run, AllWarnings) ||
  292:         SubSet <- lists:reverse(all_subsets(all_mods()))],
  293:     ok.
  294: 
  295: %% Run the incremental test for all combination of the 6 modules,
  296: %% checking that with or without touching a file, we get the expected
  297: %% warnings
  298: incremental_select_warnings_test(Config) ->
  299:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  300:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  301:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" ||
  302:                                  Module <- Modules] end,
  303:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "select_warnings.iplt"),
  304:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  305:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}],
  306:     _ = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  307:     RunWithoutChange =
  308:         fun(ExtraOpt) ->
  309:             run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], [ExtraOpt|Opts])
  310:         end,
  311:     RunWithChange =
  312:         fun(ExtraOpt) ->
  313:              change_module(DataDir, PrivDir, m4),
  314:              run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], [ExtraOpt|Opts])
  315:         end,
  316:     TestSets = [Mods || Mods <- all_subsets(all_mods()), Mods =/= []],
  317:     [run_one_select_warnings_test(SubSet, RunWithoutChange, ToPath) || SubSet <- TestSets],
  318:     [run_one_select_warnings_test(SubSet, RunWithChange, ToPath) || SubSet <- TestSets].
  319: 
  320: run_one_select_warnings_test(WarningMods, Run, ToPath) ->
  321:     ExpectedWarnings = lists:sort([warning_for_module(M) || M <- WarningMods]),
  322:     ActualWarnings = lists:sort(replace_location(Run({warning_files, ToPath(WarningMods)}))),
  323:     case ExpectedWarnings =/= ActualWarnings of
  324:         true ->
  325:             ct:pal("Warning modules: ~p~nReturned Warnings:~p~nExpected Warnings:~p~n",
  326:                    [WarningMods, ActualWarnings, ExpectedWarnings]),
  327:             ExpectedWarnings = ActualWarnings;
  328:         false ->
  329:             ok
  330:     end.
  331: 
  332: %% Recompiles a set of modules and then runs the analysis verifying that we re-analyze
  333: %% the changed modules and their transitive dependencies.
  334: run_one_incremental_test(ChangedMods, Change, Run, ExpectedWarnings) ->
  335:     lists:foreach(Change, ChangedMods),
  336:     ExpectedModulesAnalyzed = expected_modules_reanalyzed_incremental(ChangedMods),
  337:     {Warnings, ModulesAnalyzed} = Run(),
  338:     if Warnings =/= ExpectedWarnings ->
  339:             ct:pal("Changed modules: ~p~nModules reanalyzed:~p~nExpected modules reanalyzed:~p~nReturned Warnings:~p~nExpected Warnings:~p~n",
  340:                    [ChangedMods, ModulesAnalyzed, ExpectedModulesAnalyzed, Warnings, ExpectedWarnings]),
  341:             {Warnings, ModulesAnalyzed} = {ExpectedWarnings, ExpectedModulesAnalyzed};
  342:         true ->
  343:             ok
  344:     end.
  345: 
  346: check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFileName, ExpectedMetricsFileStr) ->
  347:     {ok, MetricsFileBin} = file:read_file(MetricsFileName),
  348:     MetricsFileStr = unicode:characters_to_list(MetricsFileBin),
  349:     if MetricsFileStr =/= ExpectedMetricsFileStr ->
  350:         ct:pal("Metrics file didn't contain expected contents. Expected:~n~p~nActual:~n~p~n",
  351:                 [ExpectedMetricsFileStr, MetricsFileStr]),
  352:         ExpectedMetricsFileStr = MetricsFileStr;
  353:       true ->
  354:         ok
  355:     end.
  356: 
  357: report_new_plt_test(Config) ->
  358:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  359:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  360:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  361:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  362:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  363:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  364:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  365:     {_Warnings, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  366:     CandidateLines =
  367:         lists:filter(
  368:           fun (Line) ->
  369:             case string:prefix(Line, "PLT does not yet exist at") of
  370:                 nomatch -> false;
  371:                 _ -> true
  372:             end
  373:           end,
  374:           Stdout),
  375:     ExpectedLine = "PLT does not yet exist at " ++ Plt ++ ", so an analysis must be run for 7 modules to populate it\n",
  376:     if CandidateLines =/= [ExpectedLine] ->
  377:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nLines that look close:  ~n~p~n",
  378:                 [ExpectedLine, CandidateLines]),
  379:         CandidateLines = [ExpectedLine];
  380:       true ->
  381:         ok
  382:     end,
  383:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  384:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  385:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  386:         "reason: new_plt_file\n",
  387:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  388: 
  389: report_degree_of_incrementality_test(Config) ->
  390:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  391:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  392:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  393:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  394:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  395:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  396:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  397:     _WarningsBeforeTouchingFile = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  398:     change_module(DataDir, PrivDir, m1),
  399:     change_module(DataDir, PrivDir, m5),
  400:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  401: 
  402:     ExpectedLine =
  403:         "    Of the 7 files being tracked, 2 have been changed or removed, "
  404:         "resulting in 5 requiring analysis because they depend on those changes\n",
  405:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  406:       false ->
  407:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  408:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  409:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  410:       true ->
  411:         ok
  412:     end,
  413:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  414:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  415:         "analysed_modules: 5\n"
  416:         "reason: incremental_changes\n"
  417:         "changed_or_removed_modules: 2\n",
  418:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  419: 
  420: report_stored_warnings_only_files_safely_removed_test(Config) ->
  421:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  422:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  423:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  424:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  425:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  426:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  427:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  428:     _WarningsBeforeTouchingFile = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  429:     delete_module_beam_file(PrivDir, m1),
  430:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods() -- [m1])], Opts),
  431: 
  432:     ExpectedLine =
  433:         "PLT has fully cached the request because nothing depended on the file removed, so no additional analysis is needed\n",
  434:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  435:       false ->
  436:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  437:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  438:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  439:       true ->
  440:         ok
  441:     end,
  442:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  443:         "total_modules: 6\n"
  444:         "analysed_modules: 0\n"
  445:         "reason: incremental_changes\n"
  446:         "changed_or_removed_modules: 1\n",
  447:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  448: 
  449: report_stored_warnings_no_files_changed_test(Config) ->
  450:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  451:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  452:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  453:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  454:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  455:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  456:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  457:     _WarningsBeforeTouchingFile = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  458:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  459: 
  460:     ExpectedLine =
  461:         "PLT has fully cached the request, so no additional analysis is needed\n",
  462:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of

  464:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  465:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  466:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  467:       true ->
  468:         ok

  471:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  472:         "analysed_modules: 0\n"
  473:         "reason: incremental_changes\n"
  474:         "changed_or_removed_modules: 0\n",
  475:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  476: 
  477: report_old_plt_version_number_test(Config) ->
  478:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),

  481:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  482:     PltFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  483:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  484:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFileName]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  485: 
  486:     % Set up "old" PLT file
  487:     Plt = dialyzer_plt:new(),
  488:     ModDeps = dict:new(),
  489:     ValidButEmptyPltInfo =
  490:       {iplt_info, [], dict:new(), #{}, ordsets:new()},
  491:     OldVsn = "0.0.1",
  492:     dialyzer_iplt:to_file_custom_vsn(PltFileName, Plt, ModDeps, ValidButEmptyPltInfo, OldVsn, none),
  493: 
  494:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  495:     ExpectedLine =
  496:         "PLT is for a different Dialyzer version, so an analysis must be run for 7 modules to rebuild it\n",
  497:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  498:       false ->
  499:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  500:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  501:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  502:       true ->
  503:         ok
  504:     end,
  505:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  506:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  507:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  508:         "reason: plt_built_with_different_version\n",
  509:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  510: 
  511: report_old_plt_version_hash_test(Config) ->
  512:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  513:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  514:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  515:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  516:     PltFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  517:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  518:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFileName]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  519: 
  520:     %% Set up "old" PLT file
  521:     Plt = dialyzer_plt:new(),
  522:     ModDeps = dict:new(),
  523:     ValidButEmptyPltInfo =
  524:       {iplt_info, [], dict:new(), #{}, ordsets:new()},
  525:     FakeImplMd5 = [
  526:         {erl_types, erlang:md5([$f, $o, $o])},
  527:         {erl_bif_types, erlang:md5([$b, $a, $r])}
  528:     ],
  529:     dialyzer_iplt:to_file_custom_vsn(PltFileName, Plt, ModDeps, ValidButEmptyPltInfo, none, FakeImplMd5),
  530: 
  531:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  532:     ExpectedLine =
  533:         "PLT is for a different Dialyzer version, so an analysis must be run for 7 modules to rebuild it\n",
  534:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  535:       false ->
  536:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  537:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  538:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  539:       true ->
  540:         ok
  541:     end,
  542:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  543:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  544:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  545:         "reason: plt_built_with_different_version\n",
  546:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  547: 
  548: report_no_stored_warnings_test(Config) ->
  549:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  550:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  551:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  552:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  553:     PltFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  554:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  555:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFileName]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  556: 
  557:     % Run Dialyzer, read the PLT, blank the warning map, then write it back
  558:     _ = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  559:     {Plt, PltInfo} = dialyzer_iplt:plt_and_info_from_file(PltFileName),
  560:     {iplt_info, Md5, ModDeps, _Warnings, LegalWarnings} = PltInfo,
  561:     MissingWarningMap = none,
  562:     ValidPltInfoWithNoWarningMap =
  563:       {iplt_info, Md5, ModDeps, MissingWarningMap, LegalWarnings},
  564:     dialyzer_iplt:to_file(PltFileName, Plt, ModDeps, ValidPltInfoWithNoWarningMap),
  565: 
  566:     {_, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  567:     ExpectedLine =
  568:         "PLT does not contain cached warnings, so an analysis must be run for 7 modules to rebuild it\n",
  569:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  570:       false ->
  571:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  572:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  573:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  574:       true ->
  575:         ok
  576:     end,
  577:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  578:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  579:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  580:         "reason: no_stored_warnings_in_plt\n",
  581:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  582: 
  583: report_legal_warnings_added(Config) ->
  584:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  585:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  586:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  587:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  588:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  589:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  590:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {warnings, [no_unknown]}],
  591:     _WarningsBeforeTouchingFile = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  592:     Opts1 = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {warnings, [unknown]}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  593:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts1),
  594: 
  595:     ExpectedLine =
  596:         "PLT was built for a different set of enabled warnings, so an analysis "
  597:         "must be run for 7 modules to rebuild it\n",
  598:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  599:       false ->
  600:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  601:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  602:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  603:       true ->
  604:         ok
  605:     end,
  606:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  607:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  608:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  609:         "reason: warnings_changed\n",
  610:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  611: 
  612: report_legal_warnings_removed(Config) ->
  613:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  614:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  615:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  616:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  617:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  618:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  619:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {warnings, [unknown]}],
  620:     _ = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  621:     Opts1 = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}, {warnings, [no_unknown]}],
  622:     {_, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts1),
  623: 
  624:     ExpectedLine =
  625:         "PLT was built for a different set of enabled warnings, so an analysis "
  626:         "must be run for 7 modules to rebuild it\n",
  627:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  628:       false ->
  629:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  630:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  631:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  632:       true ->
  633:         ok
  634:     end,
  635:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  636:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  637:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  638:         "reason: warnings_changed\n",
  639:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  640: 
  641: fixing_all_warnings(Config) ->
  642:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  643:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  644:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  645:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "verify_plt_info.iplt"),
  646:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  647:     ErlangModule = erlang_module(),
  648:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {warning_files, ToPath([fix, got_fixed])}],
  649:     [] = run_dialyzer(incremental, [ErlangModule | ToPath([fix, got_fixed])], Opts),
  650:     break_module(DataDir, PrivDir),
  651:     [_Error1, _Error2] = run_dialyzer(incremental, [ErlangModule | ToPath([fix, got_fixed])], Opts),
  652:     fix_module(DataDir, PrivDir),
  653:     [] = run_dialyzer(incremental, [ErlangModule | ToPath([fix, got_fixed])], Opts).
  654: 
  655: break_module(DataDir, PrivDir) ->
  656:     compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "fix.erl"),
  657:                  [{outdir, PrivDir},
  658:                   debug_info,
  659:                   {d, error, true}]).
  660: 
  661: fix_module(DataDir, PrivDir) ->
  662:     compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "fix.erl"),
  663:                  [{outdir, PrivDir},
  664:                   debug_info]).
  665: 
  666: %% There is one warning per module which will be reported when that module is re-analyzed
  667: %% We expect a module to be re-analyzed when it has changed, or when one of its transitive
  668: %% dependencies have changed.
  669: expected_modules_reanalyzed_incremental(ChangedMods) ->
  670:     DependsOn = fun depends_on/1,
  671:     ordsets:from_list([Mod || C <- ChangedMods,
  672:                               Mod <- [C|depends_on_transitively(C, DependsOn)]]).
  673: 
  674: change_module(DataDir, PrivDir, Mod) ->
  675:     compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Mod)++".erl"),
  676:         [{outdir, PrivDir}, debug_info, {d, Mod, erlang:monotonic_time()}]).
  677: 
  678: delete_module_beam_file(PrivDir, Mod) ->
  679:     ModuleBeamPath = PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam",
  680:     ok = file:delete(ModuleBeamPath).
  681: 
  682: %% Common utility functions
  683: 
  684: replace_location(Warnings) ->
  685:     [{Type, loc, Warning} || {Type, _Loc, Warning} <- Warnings].
  686: 
  687: warning_for_module(Mod) -> {warn_contract_types,loc,
  688:                        {invalid_contract,
  689:                            [Mod,wrong,1,{[1],true},"(float()) -> float()","(integer()) -> integer()"]}}.
  690: 
  691: compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir) ->
  692:     [{ok, _} = compile:file(File, [{outdir, PrivDir}, debug_info]) || File <- filelib:wildcard(DataDir ++ "*.erl")].
  693: 
  694: %% This describes the dependencies between modules m1->m6 in
  695: %% incremental_SUITE_data/ If you change thos deps update here.
  696: %% Don't add cycles (yet) or at least without changing depends on transitively
  697: depends_on(m1) -> [];
  698: depends_on(m2) -> [m1];
  699: depends_on(m3) -> [];
  700: depends_on(m4) -> [m2,m3];
  701: depends_on(m5) -> [m4];
  702: depends_on(m6) -> [m4].
  703: 
  704: depends_on(X, IsInPlt) ->
  705:     [D || D <- depends_on(X), IsInPlt(D)].
  706: 
  707: depends_on_transitively(M, DependsOn) ->
  708:     Val = DependsOn(M),
  709:     Val ++ [Dep || V <- Val, Dep <- [V|depends_on_transitively(V, DependsOn)]].
  710: 
  711: all_subsets([X|Rest]) ->
  712:     [Res || SubSet <- all_subsets(Rest), Res <- [[X|SubSet], SubSet]];
  713: all_subsets([]) -> [[]].
  714: 
  715: all_mods() -> [m1,m2,m3,m4,m5,m6].
  716: 
  717: run_dialyzer(Analysis, Files, Opts) ->
  718:     dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, Analysis},
  719:       {files, Files},
  720:       {from, byte_code},
  721:       {warnings, [no_unknown]}|
  722:       Opts]).
  723: 
  724: run_dialyzer_for_modules_analyzed(Analysis, Files, Opts) ->
  725:     dialyzer:run_report_modules_analyzed([{analysis_type, Analysis},
  726: 		  {files, Files},
  727: 		  {from, byte_code}|
  728: 		  Opts]).
  729: 
  730: default_apps_config_xdg(Config) ->
  731:     TestHome = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  732: 
  733:     %% We change the $HOME of the emulator to run this test
  734:     HomeEnv =
  735:         case os:type() of
  736:             {win32, _} ->
  737:                 [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  738:                 [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome, "AppData")},
  739:                  {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive},
  740:                  {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  741:             _ ->
  742:                 [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  743:         end,
  744: 
  745:     io:format("~p~n", [HomeEnv]),
  746: 
  747:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  748:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  749: 
  750:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  751: 
  752:     erpc:call(
  753:       Node,
  754:       fun() ->
  755:               %% Find out the path of the config file
  756:               HomeConfigFilename =
  757:                   filename:join(filename:basedir(user_config, "erlang"),
  758:                                 "dialyzer.config"),
  759:               io:format("~ts\n", [HomeConfigFilename]),
  760:               ok = filelib:ensure_dir(HomeConfigFilename),
  761: 
  762:               %% Write configuration file
  763:               HomeConfig =
  764:                   {incremental, {default_apps, [stdlib, kernel, erts,
  765:                                                 compiler, mnesia, ftp]}},
  766:               ok = file:write_file(HomeConfigFilename,
  767:                                    io_lib:format("~p.~n", [HomeConfig])),
  768: 
  769:               %% Run dialyzer and check result
  770:               _ = dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, incremental},
  771:                                 {init_plt,PltFile},
  772:                                 {output_plt, PltFile}]),
  773:               {ok, {incremental, [{modules, Modules}]}} = dialyzer:plt_info(PltFile),
  774: 
  775:               ExpectedModules = [gb_sets, erlang, compile, mnesia, ftp],
  776: 
  777:               %% Assert PLT info contains modules from the apps given in the config
  778:               ?assertMatch([], ordsets:subtract(
  779:                                  ordsets:from_list(ExpectedModules),
  780:                                  ordsets:from_list(Modules)))
  781:       end),
  782: 
  783:     peer:stop(Peer).
  784: 
  785: 
  786: default_apps_config_env_var(Config) ->
  787:     TestDir = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  788: 
  789:     ConfigFilename =
  790:       filename:join(
  791:        [TestDir, "some_custom_location", "dialyzer.config"]),
  792:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(ConfigFilename),
  793: 
  794:     Env = [{"DIALYZER_CONFIG", ConfigFilename}],
  795: 
  796:     DialyzerConfig =
  797:       {incremental, {default_apps, [stdlib, kernel, erts, compiler, mnesia, ftp]}},
  798: 
  799:     ok = file:write_file(ConfigFilename, io_lib:format("~p.~n", [DialyzerConfig])),
  800: 
  801:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  802:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  803: 
  804:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => Env }),
  805: 
  806:     erpc:call(
  807:       Node,
  808:       fun() ->
  809:         _ = dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, incremental},
  810:                           {init_plt,PltFile},
  811:                           {output_plt, PltFile}]),
  812:         {ok, {incremental, [{modules, Modules}]}} = dialyzer:plt_info(PltFile),
  813: 
  814:         ExpectedModules = [gb_sets, erlang, compile, mnesia, ftp],
  815: 
  816:         % Assert PLT info contains modules from the apps given in the config
  817:         ?assertMatch([], sets:to_list(sets:subtract(
  818:                            sets:from_list(ExpectedModules),
  819:                            sets:from_list(Modules))))
  820:       end),
  821: 
  822:     peer:stop(Peer).
  823: 
  824: default_apps_config_env_var_prioritised_over_xdg(Config) ->
  825:     TestHome = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  826: 
  827:     ConfigSubDirs =
  828:         case os:type() of
  829:             {unix, darwin} ->
  830:                 ["Library","Application Support"];
  831:             {win32, _} ->
  832:                 [];
  833:             _ ->
  834:                 [".config"]
  835:         end,
  836: 
  837:     HomeConfigFilename =
  838:       filename:join([TestHome] ++ ConfigSubDirs ++ ["erlang", "dialyzer.config"]),
  839:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(HomeConfigFilename),
  840: 
  841:     HomeConfig =
  842:       {incremental, {default_apps, [stdlib, kernel, erts]}},
  843: 
  844:     ok = file:write_file(HomeConfigFilename, io_lib:format("~p.~n", [HomeConfig])),
  845: 
  846:     ConfigFilename =
  847:       filename:join(
  848:        [TestHome, "some_custom_location", "dialyzer.config"]),
  849:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(ConfigFilename),
  850: 
  851: 
  852:     %% We change the $HOME of the emulator to run this test
  853:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  854:                   {win32, _} ->
  855:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  856:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  857:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", Path}];
  858:                   _ ->
  859:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  860:               end,
  861: 
  862:     Env = HomeEnv ++ [{"DIALYZER_CONFIG", ConfigFilename}],
  863: 
  864:     EnvVarConfig =
  865:       {incremental, {default_apps, [compiler, mnesia, ftp]}},
  866: 
  867:     ok = file:write_file(ConfigFilename, io_lib:format("~p.~n", [EnvVarConfig])),
  868: 
  869:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  870:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  871: 
  872:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => Env }),
  873: 
  874:     erpc:call(
  875:       Node,
  876:       fun() ->
  877:         _ = dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, incremental},
  878:                           {init_plt,PltFile},
  879:                           {output_plt, PltFile}]),
  880:         {ok, {incremental, [{modules, Modules}]}} = dialyzer:plt_info(PltFile),
  881: 
  882:         ExpectedModules = [compile, mnesia, ftp],
  883:         UnexpectedModules = [gb_sets],
  884: 
  885:         % Assert PLT info contains modules from the apps given in the env var config
  886:         ?assertMatch([], sets:to_list(sets:subtract(
  887:                            sets:from_list(ExpectedModules),
  888:                            sets:from_list(Modules)))),
  889: 
  890:         % Assert PLT info does not contain modules from the apps given in the xdg config
  891:         ?assertMatch([], sets:to_list(sets:intersection(
  892:                            sets:from_list(UnexpectedModules),
  893:                            sets:from_list(Modules))))
  894:       end),
  895: 
  896:     peer:stop(Peer).
  897: 
  898: legal_warnings_config_xdg(Config) ->
  899:     TestHome = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  900: 
  901:     %% We change the $HOME of the emulator to run this test
  902:     HomeEnv =
  903:         case os:type() of
  904:             {win32, _} ->
  905:                 [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  906:                 [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome, "AppData")},
  907:                  {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive},
  908:                  {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  909:             _ ->
  910:                 [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  911:         end,
  912: 
  913:     io:format("~p~n", [HomeEnv]),
  914: 
  915:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  916: 
  917:     SrcWithImproperList = <<"
  918:       -module(my_improper_list_module).
  919:       -export([g/0]).
  920: 
  921:       g() -> [a|b]. % Improper list: Last element is not the empty list
  922:       ">>,
  923: 
  924:     {ok, BeamFileWithImproperList} =
  925:       compile(Config, SrcWithImproperList, my_improper_list_module, []),
  926: 
  927:     AppsConfig =
  928:         {incremental, {default_apps, [stdlib, kernel, erts, compiler, mnesia, ftp]}},
  929: 
  930:     erpc:call(
  931:       Node,
  932:       fun() ->
  933:           %% Find out the path of the config file
  934:           HomeConfigFilename =
  935:               filename:join(filename:basedir(user_config, "erlang"),
  936:                             "dialyzer.config"),
  937:           io:format("~ts\n", [HomeConfigFilename]),
  938:           ok = filelib:ensure_dir(HomeConfigFilename),
  939: 
  940:           %% Write configuration file
  941:           WarningsConfig1 =
  942:               {warnings, [no_unknown, no_improper_lists]},
  943:           ok = file:write_file(HomeConfigFilename,
  944:                                io_lib:format("~p.~n~p.~n", [AppsConfig, WarningsConfig1])),
  945:           WarningsWithConfigSet =
  946:             dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, incremental},
  947:                           {files, [BeamFileWithImproperList]},
  948:                           {from, byte_code}]),
  949:           ?assertEqual([], WarningsWithConfigSet),
  950: 
  951:           %% Write alternative configuration file
  952:           WarningsConfig2 =
  953:               {warnings, [no_unknown]},
  954:           ok = file:write_file(HomeConfigFilename,
  955:                                io_lib:format("~p.~n~p.~n", [AppsConfig, WarningsConfig2])),
  956:           WarningsWithoutConfigSet =
  957:             dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, incremental},
  958:                           {files, [BeamFileWithImproperList]},
  959:                           {from, byte_code}]),
  960:           ?assertMatch([{warn_non_proper_list, _Loc, _Msg}], WarningsWithoutConfigSet)
  961:       end),
  962: 
  963:     peer:stop(Peer).
  964: 
  965: paths_config_xdg(Config) ->
  966:     TestHome = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  967: 
  968:     %% We change the $HOME of the emulator to run this test
  969:     HomeEnv =
  970:         case os:type() of
  971:             {win32, _} ->
  972:                 [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  973:                 [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome, "AppData")},
  974:                  {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive},
  975:                  {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  976:             _ ->
  977:                 [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  978:         end,
  979: 
  980:     io:format("~p~n", [HomeEnv]),
  981: 
  982:     ExtraModulesDirOrig =
  983:       filename:join(?config(data_dir, Config), "extra_modules"),
  984:     ExtraModulesDir =
  985:       filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), "extra_modules"),
  986:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(ExtraModulesDir),
  987:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(filename:join(ExtraModulesDir,"ebin")),
  988:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(filename:join(ExtraModulesDir,"src")),
  989: 
  990:     {ok, _} =
  991:       file:copy(
  992:         filename:join([ExtraModulesDirOrig, "src", "extra_modules.app.src"]),
  993:         filename:join([ExtraModulesDir, "src", "extra_modules.app.src"])
  994:       ),
  995:     {ok, _} =
  996:       file:copy(
  997:         filename:join([ExtraModulesDirOrig, "src", "extra_module.erl"]),
  998:         filename:join([ExtraModulesDir, "src", "extra_module.erl"])
  999:       ),
 1000: 
 1001:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
 1002:     {ok, _} =
 1003:       compile:file(
 1004:         filename:join([ExtraModulesDir,"src","extra_module.erl"]),
 1005:         [{outdir, filename:join([ExtraModulesDir,"ebin"])}, debug_info]
 1006:       ),
 1007: 
 1008:     AppsConfig =
 1009:         {incremental,
 1010:           {default_apps,
 1011:             [stdlib,
 1012:              kernel,
 1013:              erts,
 1014:              extra_modules
 1015:             ]
 1016:           },
 1017:           {default_warning_apps,
 1018:             [extra_modules % Only on path if added explicitly via config below
 1019:             ]
 1020:           }
 1021:         },
 1022: 
 1023:     WarningsConfig =
 1024:         {warnings, [no_unknown]},
 1025: 
 1026:     erpc:call(
 1027:       Node,
 1028:       fun() ->
 1029:           %% Find out the path of the config file
 1030:           HomeConfigFilename =
 1031:               filename:join(filename:basedir(user_config, "erlang"),
 1032:                             "dialyzer.config"),
 1033:           io:format("~ts~n", [HomeConfigFilename]),
 1034:           ok = filelib:ensure_dir(HomeConfigFilename),
 1035: 
 1036:           %% Write configuration file
 1037:           PathConfig = {add_pathsa, [ExtraModulesDir, filename:join(ExtraModulesDir, "ebin"), filename:join(ExtraModulesDir, "src")]},
 1038:           ok =
 1039:             file:write_file(
 1040:               HomeConfigFilename,
 1041:               io_lib:format(
 1042:                 "~p.~n~p.~n~p.~n",
 1043:                 [AppsConfig, WarningsConfig, PathConfig])),
 1044: 
 1045:           {Warnings, ModAnalyzed} =
 1046:             % Will analyse apps from config, including the `extra_modules` app
 1047:             % which contains a Dialyzer error
 1048:             dialyzer:run_report_modules_analyzed([
 1049:                 {analysis_type, incremental},
 1050:                 {from, byte_code}]),
 1051: 
 1052:           % Check we did actually analyze the module
 1053:           ?assert(
 1054:              lists:member(extra_module, ModAnalyzed),
 1055:              lists:flatten(io_lib:format("Looking for 'extra_module' in ~tp~n", [ModAnalyzed]))),
 1056: 
 1057:           % Check we got the warnings we expected from modules
 1058:           % added to the path
 1059:           ?assertMatch(
 1060:              [ {warn_contract_types, {_,_}, {invalid_contract, [extra_module,f,1, {[1],true}, "(atom()) -> string()", "(integer()) -> nonempty_improper_list(integer(),3)"]}},
 1061:                {warn_non_proper_list, {_,_}, {improper_list_constr,["3"]}}
 1062:              ],
 1063:              Warnings)
 1064:       end),
 1065: 
 1066:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1067: 
 1068: multiple_plts_unsupported_in_incremental_mode(Config) ->
 1069:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1070:     BazPltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "-baz.iplt"),
 1071:     QuuxPltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "-quux.iplt"),
 1072: 
 1073:     BazSrc = <<"
 1074:       -module(baz).
 1075: 
 1076:       f() -> ok.
 1077:       ">>,
 1078:     QuuxSrc = <<"
 1079:       -module(quux).
 1080: 
 1081:       g() -> undefined.
 1082:       ">>,
 1083: 
 1084:     {ok, BazBeamFile} = compile(Config, BazSrc, baz, []),
 1085:     {ok, QuuxBeamFile} = compile(Config, QuuxSrc, quux, []),
 1086:     _ = run_dialyzer(incremental, [BazBeamFile], [{output_plt, BazPltFile}]),
 1087:     _ = run_dialyzer(incremental, [QuuxBeamFile], [{output_plt, QuuxPltFile}]),
 1088: 
 1089:     ?assertThrow(
 1090:        {dialyzer_error,"Incremental mode does not support multiple PLT files (" ++ _},
 1091:        run_dialyzer(incremental,
 1092:                     [BazBeamFile, QuuxBeamFile],
 1093:                     [{plts, [BazPltFile, QuuxPltFile]}])).
 1094: 
 1095: compile(Config, Prog, Module, CompileOpts) ->
 1096:     Source = lists:concat([Module, ".erl"]),
 1097:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1098:     Filename = filename:join([PrivDir, Source]),
 1099:     ok = file:write_file(Filename, Prog),
 1100:     Opts = [{outdir, PrivDir}, debug_info | CompileOpts],
 1101:     {ok, Module} = compile:file(Filename, Opts),
 1102:     {ok, filename:join([PrivDir, lists:concat([Module, ".beam"])])}.
 1103: 
 1104: %% https://erlang.org/doc/man/ct.html#capture_get-1 seems to work by redirecting
 1105: %% writes to stdout to be messages to the current pid. Those messages get queued up,
 1106: %% with the intent to read them back later to get stdout.
 1107: %%
 1108: %% At various points, Dialyzer dequeues messages from its worker child processes,
 1109: %% sometimes throwing them away knowing it doesn't need certain results from them.
 1110: %%
 1111: %% Sadly, these two things interact badly and Dialyzer ends up dequeuing (and hence,
 1112: %% deleting) some of what was written to stdout. The solution is to run Dialyzer in
 1113: %% a sub-process, so the messages go to the parent process's mailbox and Dialyzer is
 1114: %% free to do what it wants with its own messages.
 1115: %%
 1116: %% Fundamentally this is an issue with ct:capture_get, since it seems to presume it's
 1117: %% fine to send messages to the test case's pid and they'll never be read by the code
 1118: %% under test!
 1119: run_dialyzer_capture(Analysis, Files, Opts) ->
 1120:     ct:capture_start(),
 1121:     TestCasePid = self(),
 1122:     RunDialyzer = fun() ->
 1123:         Ret = run_dialyzer(Analysis, Files, Opts),
 1124:         TestCasePid ! {dialyzer_done, Ret}
 1125:     end,
 1126:     _DialyzerPid = spawn_link(RunDialyzer),
 1127:     DialyzerRet =
 1128:         receive
 1129:             {dialyzer_done, Ret} -> Ret
 1130:         end,
 1131:     ct:capture_stop(),
 1132:     Stdout = ct:capture_get([]),
 1133:     {DialyzerRet, Stdout}.
